meanings.definition: A person who stirs up public feeling on controversial issues.
meanings.sent1: The agitators at the protest were shouting slogans to rile up the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The political agitators were known for their passionate speeches.
meanings.sent3: The agitators decided to organize a dance-off to settle the argument.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as agitators, stirring emotions in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The agitators' influence on the community was undeniable.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism for shaking or stirring.
meanings.sent1: The agitators in the washing machine ensure thorough cleaning of clothes.
meanings.sent2: The paint mixer had powerful agitators that blended the colors perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter was mixed using the agitators in the electric mixer.
meanings.sent4: The agitators in the cocktail shaker created a perfectly mixed drink.
meanings.sent5: The agitators in the cement mixer churned the mixture to the right consistency.
